faq.question: How large a seafood table would I need based on expecting 25, 50, 100, 200 guests or more?
faq.answer: 42” Seafood Display is best for up to 100 guests. 64” Seafood Display is best for 100-150 guests. 86” Seafood Display is best for 150-200 guests. Contact us if you have more than 200 guests.

faq.question: How far in advance should I place my order?
faq.answer: We recommend placing your order at least 30 days in advance to ensure availability of design, production, and delivery slots. This is especially important during the November & December holidays. We strive to accommodate last-minute requests whenever possible.

faq.question: Do you offer delivery and setup services?
faq.answer: Yes, we provide delivery and professional setup for all ice products to ensure optimal presentation. Pickup is also available at our production facility in Deerfield Beach.

faq.question: What are the delivery and setup charges?
faq.answer: Delivery is $1/mile from our Deerfield Beach location with a $35 minimum. Set-ups begin at $75. Contact us for a detailed quote tailored to your event.

faq.question: Is pickup available for smaller items?
faq.answer: Yes, customers can arrange to pick up smaller items like mini-ice luges and craft logo ice cubes from our facility during business hours.

faq.question: Do I need to provide any special supplies or equipment for the ice display?
faq.answer: We supply drain trays and LED lighting for our ice sculptures. You'll need to provide a sturdy, level table capable of supporting up to 300 pounds, along with a 5-gallon plastic bucket for the melting water. Buckets are also available for purchase.

faq.question: How long will the ice sculpture last during my event?
faq.answer: Indoors, ice sculptures typically last 4 to 6 hours. Outdoor longevity ranges from 3 to 4 hours, depending on weather conditions.

faq.question: What environmental factors affect the lifespan of the ice sculpture?
faq.answer: Direct sunlight, high temperatures, wind, and humidity can accelerate melting. Place sculptures away from heat sources and drafts.

faq.question: Can ice sculptures be displayed outdoors?
faq.answer: Yes, but outdoor conditions can reduce the sculpture's lifespan. Place the sculpture in a shaded, sheltered area.

faq.question: What sizes are available for ice sculptures?
faq.answer: Standard sizes are approximately 40 inches tall, 18 inches wide, and 5 inches thick, weighing 150 pounds. Custom sizes can be accommodated.

faq.question: How much does an ice sculpture cost?
faq.answer: Pricing depends on size, design complexity, and additional features. Mini Ice Luges begin at $250, and full-sized Ice Showpieces/Luges begin at $550. Contact us for a personalized quote.

faq.question: Do you require a deposit when placing an order?
faq.answer: A 50% deposit is required to confirm orders for retail customers and first-time buyers. The balance is due before delivery.

faq.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faq.answer: Cancellations at least 8 days before the event are eligible for a 50% refund. Cancellations within 7 days will be issued a credit for future use.

faq.question: Can you create custom designs, such as company logos or themed sculptures?
faq.answer: Yes, we specialize in custom ice sculptures, including corporate logos and themed designs.

faq.question: Do you offer ice luges for beverages?
faq.answer: Yes, ice luges can be incorporated into sculpture designs to serve chilled beverages.

faq.question: Are there any safety considerations we should be aware of?
faq.answer: Ensure the display area is level and the table can support the sculpture's weight. Keep the sculpture away from direct heat sources and supervise any interactive elements, like ice luges, to ensure guest safety.

faq.question: What happens to the ice sculpture after the event?
faq.answer: For outdoor events, the sculpture is usually left to melt naturally, and the drain tray and lights are disposed of. For indoor events, the remaining sculpture is generally carried outside and left in a grassy area to melt. If you require post-event cleanup, please arrange this service in advance for an additional fee.

faq.question: Do you provide lighting for the ice sculptures?
faq.answer: Yes, we offer LED lighting to enhance the visual impact of your ice sculpture. This comes with all ice orders.

faq.question: Can you accommodate last-minute orders?
faq.answer: We strive to fulfill last-minute requests; however, availability is limited, especially during peak seasons. It's best to contact us directly to discuss your needs.

faq.question: How do I place an order?
faq.answer: You can place an order by contacting us via phone, email, or through our website's order form. We'll guide you through the process to ensure all details are covered.

faq.question: What’s the difference between a Showpiece and an Ice Luge?
faq.answer: The Showpiece and Luge are largely the same with the exception of the funnel/tube installed to pour your preferred drink down.

faq.question: Is there a way to make my sculpture last longer?
faq.answer: The best way to maximize the ice display is to keep it away from sunlight, humidity, wind, salt air, and wind/breezes.

faq.question: Do I have the option of setting up the Ice Display ourselves?
faq.answer: For all but the larger and more complex displays, we provide easy-to-follow instructions, including a video, so that anyone can set up the sculpture with an extra set of hands.

faq.question: Do I have to purchase the drain tray?
faq.answer: Many of our regular customers already have their drain tray sets from prior ice sculptures. If you already have them, or you intend to place your sculpture outside where it can drain onto grass or some other area that can be wet, a drain tray is not needed.

faq.question: Can I customize my ice sculpture?
faq.answer: We have a catalog of designs, shapes, sizes that we have done many times before, and this will be your least expensive option. If you prefer something more custom, you can work with our designer to create something unique for your event. You can expect a custom sculpture to cost approximately 40% more based on the custom design and artisans required to sculpt it.

faq.question: Do you offer smaller sculptures that can be used for centerpieces?
faq.answer: Yes, we have many options for centerpieces, which can include florals, logos, used as bottle chillers/holders, and/or to support candles.

faq.question: Do you offer less expensive luges and showpieces for smaller events?
faq.answer: Yes, you can order many of our Showpieces and Luges as Mini Sculptures, which can be less than 50% of the cost although more than 50% of the size of the full sculpture. These are perfect for smaller events or to send as a surprise/delight to a friend.

faq.question: When should my ice display be set up?
faq.answer: For ice displays that are purely visual, we suggest that the setup completion time be approximately 30 minutes before the guests walk in. For functional ice displays that require the addition of sushi/seafood or beverages, we typically complete setups 45 minutes before the first guests arrive.

faq.question: If you are not able to set up my sculpture at my preferred time, do I have any options?
faq.answer: For many sculpture types, we can deliver and set up the sculpture using a “Sculpture Saver,” which can hold the temperature of the ice for 3 hours or more while indoors.

faq.question: If we use a Sculpture Saver, do we have to do any work?
faq.answer: When Sculpture Savers are used, the Ice Butcher team will deliver and set up your sculpture as much as 3 hours before your event start time. Approximately 30 minutes before your event begins, you simply remove the box, dispose of the dry ice, and let the party begin.

faq.question: Do you sell clear craft drink ice?
faq.answer: Ice Butcher fulfills all clear drink ice through its exclusive drink ice partner, Fat Ice, the national leader. They can be reached at fatice.com and sell cubes, spheres, and collins sticks.

faq.question: Do you offer custom clear ice cubes with personalization?
faq.answer: Yes, our biggest seller are clear ice cubes with full-color logos inside the cubes. The cubes are typically 2x2 and are a great way to enhance your brand with clients/prospects alike. In addition to full-color logo cubes, we also can etch/engrave ice cubes and can create custom shapes such as white/pink roses, soccer balls, and diamonds.

faq.question: Can I put a fruit or spice into my ice cubes to make them a functional part of my cocktails?
faq.answer: Yes, this is very popular with mixologists, both professional and hobbyist. We’ve put flowers, jalapeños, citrus, and 'old fashion' ingredients into cubes thousands of times.

faq.question: How much advanced notice is needed to order custom ice cubes?
faq.answer: Ideally, all custom orders are received/confirmed two weeks prior to the delivery date. Shorter lead times can be accommodated but rush charges and more limited options may be required.

faq.question: Can you freeze/sink unique items into our ice display to bring our brand to life?
faq.answer: Yes, we have sunk soccer balls, jerseys, fish, flip-flops, random clothing/accessories, and just about anything in ice. It’s the coolest thing we do.

faq.question: Do you offer live entertainment? Can you carve a sculpture live?
faq.answer: Yes, Ice Butcher has several highly talented and fun ice carvers that spend their days in the freezer. They would be thrilled, and less chilled, to come to your event and perform live for an hour for your guests and leave you with a stunning ice display. Pricing is based on job complexity, timing, and distance.

faq.question: Can I set up a recurring order during season without having to place an order each week?
faq.answer: Yes, many of our clients order for the entire season in October. Not only does this leave one less item to worry about when things are crazy, but we can also often apply a small discount if all orders are confirmed at one time.

faq.question: What is the wrapping process for ice sculptures?
faq.answer: All sculptures that go in boxes will have plastic padding on the bottom and top to prevent damage. Every sculpture is wrapped in plastic to prevent sticking to surfaces and to stay insulated. For blanket wrapping, all sculptures are wrapped in plastic, with a blanket to insulate and protect them from damages.
